description:
Just read the official OpenStack install guide PDF, but unfortunately it is Ubuntu-only.

The tradition in Open-Source group is to provide some distro-neutral documentation, perhaps how-to install NOVA from sources.

Platform: Debian 6.0.

Unzipped Nova 11.3 "Diablo" source code..

user@xrig:~/Linstall/nova-2011.3$ ./run_tests.sh 
No virtual environment found...create one? (Y/n) y
not found.
done.
Creating venv...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tools/install_venv.py", line 146, in <module>
    main(sys.argv)
  File "tools/install_venv.py", line 141, in main
    create_virtualenv()
  File "tools/install_venv.py", line 92, in create_virtualenv
    run_command(['virtualenv', '-q', '--no-site-packages', VENV])
  File "tools/install_venv.py", line 57, in run_command
    proc = subprocess.Popen(cmd, cwd=ROOT, stdout=stdout)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/subprocess.py", line 623, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/subprocess.py", line 1141, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

-Technologov, 22.02.2012.
title: Docs: Lacking section of installing from source code on Debian specifically

comments.content:
Just read the official OpenStack install guide PDF, but unfortunately it is Ubuntu-only.

The tradition in Open-Source group is to provide some distro-neutral documentation, perhaps how-to install NOVA from sources.

Platform: Debian 6.0.

Unzipped Nova 11.3 "Diablo" source code..

user@xrig:~/Linstall/nova-2011.3$ ./run_tests.sh 
No virtual environment found...create one? (Y/n) y
not found.
done.
Creating venv...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tools/install_venv.py", line 146, in <module>
    main(sys.argv)
  File "tools/install_venv.py", line 141, in main
    create_virtualenv()
  File "tools/install_venv.py", line 92, in create_virtualenv
    run_command(['virtualenv', '-q', '--no-site-packages', VENV])
  File "tools/install_venv.py", line 57, in run_command
    proc = subprocess.Popen(cmd, cwd=ROOT, stdout=stdout)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/subprocess.py", line 623, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/subprocess.py", line 1141, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

-Technologov, 22.02.2012.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~al4321

comments.content: Related to "Nova "./run_tests.sh" fails on Debian 6.0", Bug #938418
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~al4321

comments.content: sorry the patch is for Bug #938418, not this one.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~al4321

comments.content:
This guide is not for development, it is for deployment, so installing from source is not appropriate. 

There's a dev quick start at http://wiki.openstack.org/DevQuickstart as well as:

http://wiki.openstack.org/HackingNovaMacOSX
http://wiki.openstack.org/InstallFromSource

http://nova.openstack.org/devref/development.environment.html (edit the doc/source in the nova project).

All of which can be edited to include Debian.

Moving to nova as openstack-manuals is not the correct placement for dev docs.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~annegentle

comments.content:
There is no such thing as "installing from source code on Debian specifically".

Either it is multi-distro, or none at all.

Basically this document:
http://wiki.openstack.org/InstallFromSource

...should become more of a multi-distro.

But since this is a wiki, and not an official openstack-manual, I think we can close this bug as WONTFIX, and just fix the wiki later.

-Technologov
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~al4321

comments.content:
Why invalid ?
Please give some hints.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~al4321

comments.content: I think this "Invalid" means "not a bug in Nova"... and Anne explained why it's not a bug in openstack-manuals either. We don't really track "things missing from the wiki", since anyone can "just fix it".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
